97fff052-19d4-4609-a017-a470d157615d.description: The course objective is to evaluate the role of leadership in organizational culture, change, and conflict resolution; analyze leadership situations from varying points of view in order to systematically evaluate ideas and arguments; and explore how you can leverage your passion into a career. Leaders perform at least 15 hours of service-learning through a Better World Project.
97fff052-19d4-4609-a017-a470d157615d.name: Executive Leadership 302 (EXEC302)

alignments.name: CAS (Council for the Advancement of Standards in Higher Education ) Leadership Standards
alignments.description: Student Leadership Programs (SLP) must prepare students for leadership roles and responsibilities through opportunities that develop and enhance a personal philosophy of leadership that includes an understanding of self, others, and community and assist students in gaining varied leadership experiences.

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include case studies, written papers, presentations, quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, and completion of a Better World Project with a minimum passing score of 80%.

Instructional strategies include audio-visual materials, case studies, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, learner presentations, lectures, classroom exercises, and service-learning.

The Better World Project is a service-learning project that benefits a community, group or organization. The goal is to have a positive impact on others, make a difference in the lives of others, and address issues by taking action. Projects range from 18 weeks to 36 weeks and include a full project proposal, implementation, evaluation, and reflection.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

skills.name: Creativity; Problem Solving; Critical Thinking; Decision-making; Collaboration; Innovation Tool(s); Incremental Thinking; Knowledge Of Forms Of Innovation; Active Citizenship
Leadership; Advocacy; Planning; Developing Partnerships; Networking;

1ac0f695-4cd3-46d4-82ae-5132ce15e638.description: Explore leadership styles, define leadership, and understand different leadership types. Define mission and vision; identify strengths, share values, and communication skills. Learn to analyze high-performing teams, ways to motivate others, and how to be a responsible leader through diversity, empathy, social responsibility, and change. Complete a research paper about the characteristics of successful leaders, leadership styles, and potential as a successful leader.
1ac0f695-4cd3-46d4-82ae-5132ce15e638.name: Foundations of Leadership 102 (FOL102)

alignments.name: CAS (Council for the Advancement of Standards in Higher Education) Leadership Standards
alignments.description: Student Leadership Programs (SLP) must prepare students for leadership roles and responsibilities through opportunities that develop and enhance a personal philosophy of leadership that includes an understanding of self, others, and community, and assist students in gaining varied leadership experiences.

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include case studies, written papers, presentations, quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, with a minimum passing score of 80%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, case studies, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, learner presentations, lectures, classroom exercise.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

skills.name: Creativity; Problem Solving; Critical Thinking; Decision-making; Collaboration; Innovation Tool(s); Incremental Thinking; Knowledge Of Forms Of Innovation; Active Citizenship

be565975-13ac-4c3c-b1a5-03ef9fac90d7.description: The course objective is to emulate different approaches to leadership; apply leadership processes to understanding character development and trait identification in others; assess current leadership experiences and identify areas of further development; review the various leadership styles and learn how to apply that information into communication and interactions with others; and explore the nuances of emotional intelligence in action to gain buy-in, respect, and overall cooperation.
be565975-13ac-4c3c-b1a5-03ef9fac90d7.name: Advanced Leadership 202 (ADV202)

alignments.name: CAS (Council for the Advancement of Standards in Higher Education ) Leadership Standards
alignments.description: Student Leadership Programs (SLP) must prepare students for leadership roles and responsibilities through opportunities that develop and enhance a personal philosophy of leadership that includes an understanding of self, others, and community and assist students in gaining varied leadership experiences.

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include case studies, written papers, presentations, quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, and more with a minimum passing score of 80%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, case studies, discussion, computer-based training, learner presentations, lectures, classroom exercise.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

1822ec6a-2555-4c8f-92cd-095c98dbe596.description: The course objective is to evaluate the role of leadership in organizational culture, change, and collaboration; communicate a project plan, implementation of project management, and explore how to leverage passion into a career. Leaders perform at least 15 hours of service-learning through a Better World Project.
1822ec6a-2555-4c8f-92cd-095c98dbe596.name: Executive Leadership 301 (EXEC301)

alignments.name: CAS (Council for the Advancement of Standards in Higher Education ) Leadership Standards
alignments.description: Student Leadership Programs (SLP) must prepare students for leadership roles and responsibilities through opportunities that develop and enhance a personal philosophy of leadership that includes an understanding of self, others, and community and assist students in gaining varied leadership experiences.

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include written and/or presentations, quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, and completion of a Better World Project of at least 15 hours.
Instructional strategies include audio-visual materials, computer-based training, practical exercises, learner presentations, and service-learning.

The Better World Project is a service-learning project that benefits a community, group or organization. The goal is to have a positive impact on others, make a difference in the lives of others, and address issues by taking action. Projects range from 18 weeks to 36 weeks and include a full project proposal, implementation, evaluation, and reflection.

cbbdb6ab-48b5-4a86-b50d-37c88794ed11.name: Advanced Leadership 201 (ADV201)

alignments.name: CAS (Council for the Advancement of Standards in Higher Education ) Leadership Standards
alignments.description: Student Leadership Programs (SLP) must prepare students for leadership roles and responsibilities through opportunities that develop and enhance a personal philosophy of leadership that includes an understanding of self, others, and community and assist students in gaining varied leadership experiences.

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, and a Leadership Portfolio submission with a minimum passing score of passing.
Instructional strategies include audiovisual materials, community discussion, computer-based training, lectures, portfolio submission.

5b678a07-e523-4851-861d-4958bb1edb01.description: The Foundations of Leadership 101-1 Certificate is part one of a two-part course teaching leadership skills.
5b678a07-e523-4851-861d-4958bb1edb01.name: Foundations of Leadership 101-1 Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: The Foundations of Leadership 101-1 Certificate signifies that a foundational level of leadership has been achieved. The recipient has demonstrated an understanding of personal communication styles and created a purpose statement. The recipient has also created a personal vision statement, defined a group goal, found tools and resources to overcome obstacles and identified a long-term goal, and created mini-milestones to achieve the goal.

4ae1e09f-1aae-400e-b198-e108e5b684d6.description: The Foundations of Leadership 101-2 is part two of a course on leadership development.
4ae1e09f-1aae-400e-b198-e108e5b684d6.name: Foundations of Leadership 101-2 Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: The Foundations of Leadership 101-2 Certificate signifies that a foundational level of leadership has been achieved. The recipient has also created a personal vision statement, defined a group goal, found tools and resources to overcome obstacles and identified a long-term goal, and created mini-milestones to achieve the goal.
